EINSTEIN PERSONALIZATION
Map Data Model Objects for Einstein Personalization

Einstein Personalization requires that you install certain data model objects (DMOs) in Data Cloud. If you installed Einstein Personalization using the data kit, the standard DMOs are already mapped. However, you need to manually map the Einstein Personalization custom attribution DMOs.

REQUIRED USER PERMISSIONS
USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To map objects:	

Data Cloud Admin OR

Data Cloud for Marketing Admin OR

Data Cloud For Marketing Data Aware Specialist

Before you map objects, set up the data connectors and data streams, and create the required DMOs.

For information on which DMOs are mapped, see What the Einstein Personalization Data Kit Installs.

For the object and field names to map, see Einstein Personalization Required Object Mapping References.

In Data Cloud, go to the Data Lake Objects tab.
Select the data lake object (DLO) that you want to map.
Under Data Mapping, click Start.
Under Data Model entities, click Select Objects.
The field-mapping canvas shows the source DLOs on the left and target DMOs on the right.
Under All Objects, select the data model object to map to. You can select more than one DMO.
Click Done.
Using the mappings for each object in Einstein Personalization Attribution Object Field Mappings, select the field to map in the DLO and click the related field in the DMO to establish a mapping connection.
After mapping all the required DLOs, click Save.
SEE ALSO
